articles.author: Simon Lewis, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: Mongolia will deepen cooperation with Washington to mine rare earths, the country's Prime Minister L. Oyun-Erdene said on a visit to Washington on Wednesday, but he warned that a "new Cold War" between the U.S. and China would harm the global economy.
articles.title: Exclusive: Mongolia to deepen cooperation with US on rare earths, PM says on Washington visit

articles.author: Zeba Siddiqui
articles.description: A Russian government-linked hacking group took aim at dozens of global organizations with a campaign to steal login credentials by engaging users in Microsoft Teams chats pretending to be from technical support, Microsoft researchers said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Microsoft says Russia-linked hackers behind dozens of Teams phishing attacks

articles.author: Clare Jim
articles.description: Shares of Evergrande Property Services Group (6666.HK) shed 50% of their value on Thursday when trading resumed after 16 months, following the release of its financial results and the end of an investigation into misused funds involving its parent.
articles.title: Evergrande services arm shares halve as trading resumes after 16 months

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's services activity expanded at a slightly faster pace in July, supported by a jump in business in the summer travel season, a private-sector business survey showed on Thursday, partly offsetting the drag from the weak manufacturing sector.
articles.title: China's July services activity expands at quicker pace - Caixin PMI

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Morgan Stanley has upgraded its view on Indian markets to "overweight" from "equal weight", citing easing valuations as compared to October 2022, when the global brokerage identified the onset of a new bull market in Asian and emerging market equities.
articles.title: Morgan Stanley upgrades India to "overweight", terms it top pick among emerging markets

articles.author: Stella Qiu
articles.description: Asian shares were subdued on Thursday after Fitch downgraded U.S. sovereign debt sparking profit-taking, with investors now shifting focus to Bank of England's rate decision and earnings from Apple and Amazon.
articles.title: Asian shares hesitant after Wall Street sell-off, dollar buoyant

articles.author: David Stanway
articles.description: China approved more than 50 gigawatts (GW) of new coal power in the first half of 2023, research by environment group Greenpeace showed, with the world's top carbon polluter focused on energy security rather than cutting fossil fuel consumption.
articles.title: China's energy security push drives up fossil fuel approvals - research

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces have made no headway along the front lines, but are entrenched in heavily mined areas they control, making it difficult for Ukrainian troops to move east and south, Ukrainian officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Ukraine says Russians fail to advance but are well dug in

articles.author: Steve Holland, Heather Timmons
articles.description: Former Vice President Mike Pence, who confounded attempts by then-President Donald Trump to remain in power after losing the 2020 election, features prominently in the indictment charging Trump with orchestrating a plot to overturn the result.
articles.title: Pence and a Christmas call star in Trump indictment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Northern Taiwan on Thursday shut businesses and schools while airlines cancelled dozens of flights as the slow-moving Typhoon Khanun skirted past the island's northeast amid warnings of floods and high winds.
articles.title: Typhoon Khanun shuts markets, grounds flights in Taiwan
